term.title: eighteen-electron rule

item.text: An electron-counting rule to which an overwhelming majority of stablediamagnetic transition metal complexes adhere. The number of nonbonded electrons at the metal plus the number of electrons in the metal-ligand bonds should be 18. The 18 electron rule in transition metal chemistry is a full analogue of the 'Lewis octet rule'.
